body: -- Types of SQL commands: --1. DDL (Data Definition language) - create, alter, rename, drop, truncate --a. CREATE (to create database object) create table emp2 ( emp_id number, emp_name varchar2(50), department varchar2(30), salary number(10,2) ); desc emp2; --b. ALTER (to make any changes in database object structure) alter table emp2 add hire_date date; -- to add new column alter table emp2 drop column salary; -- to remove exisitng column alter table emp2 rename COLUMN department to dept; -- to rename column alter table emp2 modify dept char(30); -- to modify dataype of column --c. Rename: rename emp2 to emp3; --d. DROP and TRUNCATE --d.1. DROP - (it is used to delete all data + structure) drop table emp3; --d.2. TRUNCATE - (it is used to delete all data but structure remains as it is) truncate table emp3; --2. DML (Data Manipulation Language): insert, delete, update --a. INSERT (is used to insert data in table) insert into emp2 values (1,'A','IT',10000); insert into emp2 (emp_id, emp_name) values (6,'F'); insert into emp2 values (2,'B','CS',11000); insert into emp2 values (3,'C','CS',23000); insert into emp2 values (4,'D','IT',14000); insert into emp2 values (5,'E','IT',15000); --b. UPDATE (is used to update the data in table) update emp2 set department='CS', salary=15000 where emp_id=6; --c. DELETE (to delete the data from table) delete from emp2 where emp_id=6;

title: Afternoon Practice Session
body: -- DQL (Data Query Language) : is used to fetch the data from table-- SELECT select * from emp_master; --Operators that can be used with select statements: --1. where clause: (to give any specific condition for data retrieval) select * from emp_master where emp_name='D'; --2. order by: (to arrange the data in specific order asc or desc) select * from emp_master order by emp_name asc; --3. LIKE (to fetch the data based on any given pattern) select * from emp_master where emp_name like '% Gupta'; --4. DISTINCT: (is used to fetch the unique records and it discards the duplicate entry in output) select distinct emp_id, emp_name, salary, department from emp_master; --5. BETWEEN (to view the data between given range) select * from emp_master where salary between 10000 and 13000; --6. IN (is used to fetch the record with the matching values) select * from emp_master where salary in (10000,12000); --7. IS NULL (to check if the column value is null or not) select * from emp_master where salary is null; update emp_master set emp_name ='Anuj Gupta' where emp_id=2;

body: --DCL (Data Control Language) --DCL is used to control access rights and permissions on database objects like tables, views, sequences, indexes, procedures, triggers etc. -->> GRANT and REVOKE --GRANT -- to give the access of db object to any user --CREATE a user create user demo_user identified by admin; -- To give session access grant create session to demo_user; -- To view all system users select * from all_users where username ='DEMO_USER'; -- GRANT table access GRANT select, insert, update ON EMP_MASTER TO demo_user; --Revoke: to take back/remove the access from db object. revoke delete on emp_master from demo_user; --COMMENT: to add any description or info.. --1. body: --DML (Merge): Merge is used when we want to update a row if its exists or insert a new row if its does not exist. create table emp_main (id number(5), name varchar(50), salary number(8)); create table emp_new (id number(5), name varchar(50), salary number(8)); insert into emp_main values (101, 'Rahul',30000); insert into emp_main values (102, 'Sneha',35000); insert into emp_new values (101, 'Rahul',40000); insert into emp_new values (103, 'Amit',28000); select * from emp_new; merge into emp_main m using emp_new n on (m.id=n.id) when matched then update set m.salary=n.salary when not matched then insert (id, name, salary) values (n.id,n.name,n.salary); select * from emp_main; insert into emp_new values (104,'Rohan', 40000); insert into emp_new values (105,'Ram', 30000); insert into emp_new values (106,'Shyam', 41000); commit; insert into emp_new values (107,'Ajay', 25000); insert into emp_new values (108,'Avinash', 50000); insert into emp_new values (109,'Gautam', 40000); rollback; select * from emp_new; INSERT INTO emp_new VALUES (107, 'Ajay',45000); SAVEPOINT sp1; INSERT INTO emp_new VALUES (108, 'Gautam',35000); savepoint sp2; DELETE FROM emp_new WHERE id = 101; ROLLBACK TO sp2; COMMIT;

body: --TCL (Transaction Control Language): It is used to save or revrt back the transaction operations in db memory. --DDL : this are auto-committed (create, alter, drop, truncate, rename) --DML : (insert, update, delete, merge) -- 1. COMMIT: is used to save the operation result permanently in db memory select * from emp_new; insert into emp_new values (104,'Rohit',35000); insert into emp_new values (105,'Aman',45000); commit; select * from emp_new; -- 2. ROLLBACK: is used to revert back/undo the changes/operation result insert into emp_new values (106,'Sneha',25000); insert into emp_new values (107,'Sahil',15000); rollback; -- 3. SAVEPOINT: Marks a point within a transaction to which you can roll back. INSERT INTO EMP_NEW VALUES (106, 'Sahil', 30000); SAVEPOINT sp1; INSERT INTO emp_new VALUES (107, 'Sneha',40000); SAVEPOINT sp2; DELETE FROM emp_new WHERE id = 101; -- Rollback to a savepoint (only undoes statements after sp1) ROLLBACK TO sp1; -- Commit remaining changes COMMIT;

body: --Restrict and Sort Data: --1. where clause:  (is used to fetch the data based on certain condition) select * from emp_new where id=101; --2. order by: (is used to sort data in asc or desc order): select * from emp_new order by id desc; --3. Arithmetic operators: (+,-,*,/) --(+): is used to add numbers: select 10 + 5 + 5 as result from dual; --(-): We can subtract the values: select 15 - 5 - 5 as result from dual; --(*):  to perform multiplication: select 5 * 10 as result from dual; --(/):  to perform division: select 50 / 10 as result from dual; select 10 +  nvl(null,0) as result from dual; --BODMAS rule: (Bracket, Off, Division, mul, add, sub): select 10 + 20 * 3 - (8 / 2 + 6) * 2 as result from dual; --Inner bracket: 8 / 2= 4 --Inner addition: 4 + 6 = 10 --Multiply: 10 * 2 = 20 --Main: 10 + 20 * 3 - 20 --Multiply: 20 * 3 = 60 --Final: 10 + 60 - 20= 70 - 20 = 50 --Comparison and relational operators: --1. = equals to select * from emp_new where salary = 50000; --2. != or <> select * from emp_new where salary != 50000; --3. > (greater than),  < (less than) select * from emp_new where salary > 30000; select * from emp_new where salary < 30000; --4. >= (greater than equals to) , <= (less than equals to) select * from emp_new where salary >= 30000; select * from emp_new where salary <= 30000; --LOGICAL operators: --(AND, OR, NOT) --1. AND: All conditions should be true. select * from emp_new where id =101 AND name='Rahul' and salary=50000; --2. OR: At least one condition must be true select * from emp_new where id=101 OR name='Sahil'; --3. NOT: Reverses the condition(true becomes false) select * from emp_New where not salary=50000 ; --DESC Keyword: is used to describe db object; desc emp_new; --TO COUNT TABLE COLUMN VALUES select count(*) from user_tab_columns where table_name ='EMP_NEW';
